Issues.Title: [release/10.0] fix #13813 : Dark Mode: The ForeColor & BackColor properties are not working for the controls
Issues.Body: Backport of #13818 to release/10.0 /cc @Epica3055 ## Proposed changes Add code to see if BackColor or ForeColor is specified in dark mode, if so then use the specified color, if not then let the renderer decide the color. ## Screenshots ### Before ### After

Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "[release/10.0] Source code updates from dotnet/dotnet" (#13845)

Issues.Title: Anchors of user control don't work when scaling on high DPI (reproduced again)
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 9

.NET SDK:
 Version:           9.0.304

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

_No response_

### Issue description

The problem described in [#6381](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/6381) is reproduced in .NET 9.

From the original description.

> When components are inside a user control, their anchors work incorrect when scaling.

There is a workaround mentioned in the original issues:

> Whenever creating a UserControl where inside the UserControl you want to anchor controls, first create a panel inside the UserControl and set the panel to Dock Fill. Then anchor the controls inside that panel and not directly inside the UserControl.

The workaround works for me.



### Steps to reproduce

I found it in my own solution. But I also tried the sample project from [#6381](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/6381) - https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/7756538/ControlScalingBug.zip, switched it to .NET 9, and it did not work properly either.

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/9687743e-2553-4604-9a21-c155488a21a9)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Anchors of user control don't work when scaling on high DPI (reproduced again)" (#13841)

Issues.Title: Fix Control.Dispose crash when dependent UserControl fails to load due to missing assembly
Issues.Body:
<!-- Please read CONTRIBUTING.md before submitting a pull request -->

Fixes #13835

## Root Cause

When a control (e.g., MainObject) references another control (ExternalObject) from a separate assembly (ExternalAsm), and that assembly is missing at runtime, the constructor of MainObject fails. However, the .NET runtime still attempts to call `Dispose()` on the partially constructed control. Inside `Control.Dispose`, accessing `ContextMenuStrip` triggers a `NullReferenceException` because `Properties` is not initialized.

## Proposed changes

- Added a defensive null check around `ContextMenuStrip` access in `Control.Dispose()`
- Replaced direct property access with `Properties?.TryGetValue(...)` to ensure safe event unsubscription

<!-- We are in TELL-MODE the following section must be completed -->

## Customer Impact

- This change ensures that `Control.Dispose()` can safely execute even when the control was never fully constructed.

## Regression? 

- Yes

## Risk

- Minimal

<!-- end TELL-MODE -->


## Screenshots <!-- Remove this section if PR does not change UI -->

### Before

Run the attached project [net10Issue.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22095433/net10Issue.zip) using .NET 10 framework, crash with Exception thrown: 'System.NullReferenceException' in System.Windows.Forms.dll


https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/a7b5e494-0e72-48cb-944a-5b9c580f5fd6


### After

App exits successfully.

https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/1fe967cd-f68a-4897-b4e3-7990c010957a


## Test methodology <!-- How did you ensure quality? -->

- Manually


## Test environment(s) <!-- Remove any that don't apply -->

- .net 10.0.0-rc.1.25420.121


<!-- Mention language, UI scaling, or anything else that might be relevant -->

 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/13840)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fix Control.Dispose crash when dependent UserControl fails to load due to missing assembly" (#13840)

Issues.Title: .NET 10 app crash with Exception thrown: 'System.NullReferenceException' in System.Windows.Forms.dll
Issues.Body:
### Description

I'm trying to create a object (MainObject) that references another object (ExternalObject) defined in another assembly (ExternalAsm).
Both MainObject and ExternalObject are UserControl.
The issue occurs when ExternalAsm is missing:
Despite MainObject is not created (because of missing ExternalObject), Control.Dispose is called and fails because Control.Properties is null.

### Reproduction Steps

Run the attached project [net10Issue.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22095433/net10Issue.zip) using  .NET 10 framework

### Expected behavior

App exits successfully.

### Actual behavior

crash with Exception thrown: 'System.NullReferenceException' in System.Windows.Forms.dll

### Regression?

Yes, it won't happen in .NET 9 or lower.

### Known Workarounds

Add try / catch in MainObject Dispose - but this is not an option when using third party assemblies.

### Configuration

.NET 10, Windows 10/11, AnyCPU

### Other information

The MainObject cannot be created (which is correct) but somehow an incomplete object is created and processed by GC. GC will call then Dispose on the incomplete initialized object MainObject which can lead to NullReferenceException.
The issue happens when you create more than 1 instances of MainObject but never for a single one.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue ".NET 10 app crash with Exception thrown: 'System.NullReferenceException' in System.Windows.Forms.dll" (#13835)

Issues.Title: .NET 9.0 Error with DialogFileOpen
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 9.0


### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

.NET 8.0

### Issue description

I created a vb.net projekt with .NET 9.0 via project wizzard. The Project only contains a FileOpenDialog from object pallete. As soon as the dialoge is used the programm unexpectedly closes with the following text:

The program '[11668] TestNet9.exe' has exited with code 3221226505 (0xc0000409).

I changed the project to .NET 8.0 without any further modifications. Now there is no problem anymore!

### Steps to reproduce

1. Create new Project with vb.net 9.0
2. Add a new FileOpenDialog
3. Compile and run program
4. Open dialog
5. close dialog
6. wait some seconds (+- 30 seconds)
7. program closes with code 3221226505 (0xc0000409).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue ".NET 9.0 Error with DialogFileOpen" (#13832)

Issues.Title: Dark Mode: Button ForeColor ignored in Dark Mode when FlatStyle is Flat/Popup and Form.ForeColor Is set
Issues.Body: ### .NET version .NET SDK 10.0.100-rc.2.25420.109 ### Did it work in .NET Framework? No ### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+? Yes, The issue doesn't reproduce on .NET SDK 9.0.7 build ### More info 1. The issue also occurs when the Form's BackColor is set 2. The issue also occurs when add button to the container and set container's ForeColor/BackColor ### Issue description In Dark Mode, after setting the Form's ForeColor, the ForeColor of buttons with `FlatStyle.Flat` or `FlatStyle.Popup` does not take effect. .NET SDK 10.0.100-rc.2.25420.109: .NET SDK 9.0.7: ### Steps to reproduce 1. Create a WinForms .NET application with Form.ForeColor is set to Red 2. Add a button to the form designer, set button's FlatStyle as Flat or Popup 3. Enable DarkMode by Application.SetColorMode(SystemColorMode.Dark) in Program.cs file 4. Run application, observe the ForeColor of Button [TestProject.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22002602/TestProject.zip)

Issues.Title: Update the OwnerDraw flag when BackgroundImage changes
Issues.Body: Fixes #13823 ## Root Cause The `OwnerDraw` property of the Button control incorrectly returns `false` when `BackgroundImage` is set during early initialization. This is due to the `OwnerDraw` logic checking `BackgroundImage == null` before the control's handle is created, which causes a premature fallback to the system renderer. As a result, even though `BackgroundImage` is later assigned, it is ignored during rendering in `FlatStyle.Standard` mode. ## Proposed changes - Invoking `UpdateOwnerDraw` in `BackgroundImage` property of Button.cs to update the `OwnerDraw` flag to ensure correct visual behavior ## Customer Impact - The BackgroundImage of Button can be displayed when the FlatStyle is Standard in DrakMode ## Regression? - Yes ## Risk - Minimal ## Screenshots ### Before The BackgroundImage of Button is not displayed when the FlatStyle is Standard in DrakMode ### After The BackgroundImage of Button displayed when the FlatStyle is Standard in DrakMode ## Test methodology - Manually ## Test environment(s) - .net 10.0.0-rc.1.25418.105 ###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://microsoft.github.io/open-pr/?codeflow=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/13824)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Update the OwnerDraw flag when BackgroundImage changes" (#13824)

Issues.Title: Dark Mode: The BackgroundImage of Button is not displayed when the FlatStyle is Standard in DrakMode
Issues.Body: ### .NET version .NET SDK 10.0.100.rc.2.25419.103 ### Did it work in .NET Framework? No ### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+? The issue also can reproduce on .NET SDK 10.0 Prevview7. there has the known issue https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/13720 to track. after the fix of PR https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/13809, the issue has been fixed when the FlatStyle is Flat/Popup, but still reproduce when the FaltStyle is Standard ### Issue description The BackgroundImage of Button is not displayed when the FlatStyle is Standard in DrakMode **.NET 10.0 rc.2 & rc.1 results:** **.NET 10.0 preview7 results:** **.NET 9.0 results:** ### Steps to reproduce 1. Create a winforms app, a form and a button with a background image. 2. Run the project in DarkMode 3. Observe results
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Dark Mode: The BackgroundImage of Button is not displayed when the FlatStyle is Standard in DrakMode" (#13823)
